Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as Orwellian and an offense to democracy.
Governments have historically been the main purveyors of misinformation.
The legislation stifles debate and discourse, likening it to systems in China and North Korea.
The definitions of key terms like 'serious harm' and 'misinformation' are vague and inconsistent.
The broad definitions could lead to overreach and misinterpretation.
ACMA lacks the mandate and power to enforce laws outside Australia.
The legislation could drive users to alternative platforms, weakening existing ones.
Notable Quotes: This Orwellian legislation is an offense to democracy.
Stifling debate, discourse, and opposing views will prevent any chance of moving forward with our society.
Attempting to regulate global free speech is overreach on an absurd scale.
